communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Amount invested into new Faregate equipment installation since May 2021.
-Number of new Faregate installations since they have moved to the new model in Summer 2021
-Number of broken faregates in May 2021.

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am an affiliate of HIPS DC and will be using this information for internal analysis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grant Colby

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Amount of billable hours the MTPD has patrolled the Metro system in which fare evasion was part of the shift duties. Weekly or monthly reports over 2018-2022 are ideal.
-Itemized expense report of each fare-evasion prevention project from 2018-2022
-reports relating to the effectiveness of said fare-evasion projects from 2018-2022
-Reports relating to future plans of fare-evasion policing and projected expenses of fare-evasion prevention tactics from 2018-2022

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am an affiliate of HIPS DC and will be using this information for internal analysis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grant Colby

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Itemized report of the cost of the $22.7 million dollar contract with Armoured One since it began in 2020. 
Cost Reports of hardware improvement to schools (new doors, bullet proof glass, etc.) included in the contract to protect students. 
Current Roadmap for continued projects and expenses with the current contract for Amoured One.

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am an affiliate of HIPS DC and will be using this information for internal analysis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grant Colby

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Monthly Expendature and Requests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Monthly Expense reports between January 2018 and November 2022. 
-Itemized reports and receipts over the same date range detailing what was purchased and spent each month across the entirety of the MPD, including office expenses such as new office equipment and bonuses such as sign on benefits.
If these documents exist on a per-precinct bases and a total across the entirety of the Metropolitan Police Department, both are requested.
Budgets and expenditures including contracts signed that have been enacted in programs such as new equipment initiatives and external contractors.

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am an affiliate of HIPS DC and will be using this information for internal analysis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grant Colby
